ygData.msgSnippet: Roop, you never cease to make me chuckle. Hee hee, maybe the bards on Veeshan are a mor mature.... oh wait no we just have lots of japanese uber players. eesh.
ygData.messageBody:
Roop, you never cease to make me chuckle. Hee hee, maybe the bards on Veeshan
are a mor mature.... oh wait no we just have lots of japanese uber players.
eesh. Why can't we have another server and station it in japan for them. Its
reallya pain when you get online at say, 10:00 AM on your day off and expect to
have a server population of 600-1000 and scroll down to find veeshan has 1800
people on it. Argh!
Penaden Songweaver

Roop Dirump wrote:

> From: "Roop Dirump" <roop@...>
>
> You know, maybe we have a LOT of really dumb bards on E'ci... as well as
> those more informed E'ci folk who frequent this list--of course. I once
> mentioned the bard I grouped with who never played anything but Hymn
> (constantly, even when everyone was healed), Accelerando (of course), and
> Bellow. She only bellowed in battle, and you know... bellow is probably the
> least effective of any of our battle songs. Bellow gives that instant
> gratification, it's very noticeable... but really isn't that great. She
> said "bellow is the only one that works for me." How innane!
>
> But I saw something tonight that truely shocked me. I was literally
> speechless. Had damaged myself falling, and decided to heal up by the zone
> a bit before heading on. Targeted a bard a bit off, and saw he was quite
> hurt, noticed his con around level 18 or 19. I realized he was sitting,
> singing hymn. I sauntered over and said, "You know, that song would be much
> more effective with an instrument." He replied, "Ya, but I don't like
> carrying all that stuff."
>
> Carrying all that stuff.
>
> "A bard who doesn't like carrying instruments???" And he just said, "Yup."
> But a mandolin weighs absolutely nothing! But the songs are much more
> effective when played, singing them is like like like.... I couldn't say
> anything. I just said, "Looks like somebody picked the wrong class...." and
> zoned in disgust! Then crashed! My client was agast too!
>
> It's like a warrior saying he doesn't like wearing all that junk, or a mage
> saying he doesn't like learning all that stuff. Eeeesh... that has to be
> the dumbest bard I've ever seen. One of those people who probably picked
> the class to be a warrior with a personal SoW. He gives all of us a BAD
> name, just pray he solos exclusively!
>
> Roop
>
> >From: Mike Roach <mroach@...>
> snip!
> >Solidarity bard brothers and sisters, we must educate the masses to our
> >usefulness, especially our fellow bards like the one I ran into in Unrest
> on
> >Sunday. Here is this level 20 bard with full bronze plate and some very
> >very nice unique items in a group that I join up with and I don't even
> >realize he is a bard until I am in the group for about 15 minutes and go to
> >turn off the healing song and realize I am not singing it. He is running
> in
> >and out of the house pulling green mobs (we were both the same level at the
> >time) and I ask him 3 times, "what songs will you be singing during
> >battles?" so I can get an idea of what I should be using to compliment him.
> >Finally he responds, "Bellow, unless you have any requests..." and runs
> back
> >into the house. Next thing you know he is shouting "zone!" and runs to the
> >zone with a train of green monsters from the yard following him. I thought
> >I should probably have attempted to educate this fellow but instead I got
> >disgusted with the whole absurd scene and excused myself from the group.
> >
> >Faras Tar'Linedhel
> >Half-Elf Bard of the 21st song
> >E'ci
